de.wwu.muggl.vm
Class VirtualMachine

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      de.wwu.muggl.vm.VirtualMachine
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RealVirtualMachine, SymbolicVirtualMachine
public abstract class VirtualMachine
extends java.lang.Thread

This abstract class represents a virtual machine for the execution of java bytecode. It has methods offering general virtual machine functionality. They can be utilized by concrete virtual machine implementations.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-07-15
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Constructor Detail

VirtualMachine

public VirtualMachine(Application application,
                      MugglClassLoader classLoader,
                      ClassFile classFile,
                      Method initialMethod)
               throws InitializationException
Basic Constructor. Beside setting the specified parameters as local values and setting some internal fields to initial their values, it will reset the class loader's number of already instantiated classes and make sure that statically initialized classes of prior executions are dropped.

Parameters:
application - The application this virtual machine is used by.
classLoader - The main classLoader to use.
classFile - The classFile to start execution with.
initialMethod - The Method to start execution with. This Method has to be a method of the supplied classFile.
Throws:
InitializationException - If initialization of auxiliary classes fails.

runMainLoop

protected void runMainLoop(Frame visualStartingFrame)
                    throws ExecutionException,
                           java.lang.InterruptedException,
                           InvalidInstructionInitialisationException
While the virtual machine stack is not empty, objects are popped from it. If the proper object is a frame, it is executed. If not, it has to be a returned object from a method. If the stack is not empty, the next element has to be a frame and it is popped off it; then the object is pushed onto its operand stack and the frame executed. If the stack however is empty, the object is the applications return value and threatened as such. The execution then ends.

Parameters:
visualStartingFrame - If step by step execution is enabled, there will be no stepping until this frame has been reached.
Throws:
ExecutionException - Thrown on any fatal error that happens during execution and is not coped by one of the other Exceptions.
java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown to signal the manual end of the step by step execution.
InvalidInstructionInitialisationException - Any fatal problems with the parsing and the initialization will lead to this exception.
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError - If the virtual machine runs out for memory, this error is thrown.
java.lang.StackOverflowError - If the operand stack of a frame or the virtual machine stack exceeds its element limit, this Error is thrown.

executeFrame

protected void executeFrame(boolean allowStepping)
                     throws ExecutionException,
                            java.lang.InterruptedException,
                            InvalidInstructionInitialisationException
Execute the current frame. First the Method and its instructions are loaded, then the frame is set active. The main execution loop runs as long as it is active, the pc is not beyond the last instruction and it is not explicitly left.

Parameters:
allowStepping - If set to false there will not be no stepping even if step by step mode is enabled. This is used to skip static initializers.
Throws:
ExecutionException - An exception is thrown on any fatal errors during execution.
java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown to signal the manual end of the step by step execution.
InvalidInstructionInitialisationException - Any fatal problems with the parsing and the initialization will lead to this exception.

executeInstruction

protected abstract void executeInstruction(Instruction instruction)
                                    throws ExecutionException
Abstract method for the actual instruction Execution.

Parameters:
instruction - The instruction that is to be executed.
Throws:
ExecutionException - An exception is thrown on any fatal errors during execution.

                               Method method,
                               java.lang.Object[] arguments)
                        throws ExecutionException

Parameters:

method - The Method that this frame holds.
arguments - The arguments that will be stored in the local variables prior to execution.
Throws:
ExecutionException - On any fatal error that happens during execution and is not coped by one of the other Exceptions.

Returns:

executeTheCurrentFrameForClassInitialization

public void executeTheCurrentFrameForClassInitialization(Method method)
Create a new frame, invoke executeFrame() and catch any exception thrown, throwing an ExceptionInInitializerError in such a case. Restore the virtual machines state afterwards. DO NOT INVOKE THIS METHOD UNLESS YOU ARE ABSOLUTELY SURE WHAT YOU ARE DOING AND UNDERSTAND THE CONTROL FLOW. Warning: This method is only meant to be called by the class InitializedClass as a way of initializing a class. Invoking it for any other reason or in any other case might lead to a fatal execution error in the virtual machine and will at least result in an completely unexpected behaviour of the virtual machine.

Parameters:
method - The method to be used for initialization. Must have a signature of
Throws:
java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError - If the methods' is not or if any Exception is returned.

changeCurrentFrame

public void changeCurrentFrame(Frame frame)
Change the current frame. Never change this.currentFrame directly, as concrete vm implementations might override this method in order to keep track of current frame changes.

Parameters:
frame - The frame to become the current frame.

setRunUntilNoOfInstructionsReached

public void setRunUntilNoOfInstructionsReached(long numberOfInstructions)
If executing in step by step mode, a number of instructions can be supplied that will be executed without stepping. While doing so, there is no control about the execution. However, it runs as fast as possible. Hence, this can be used to inspect the behavior of applications after an arbitrary number of instructions has already been executed. Should the execution already run in this mode, the target number of instruction is updated.

Parameters:
numberOfInstructions - The number of instructions to executed without a stop.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the number of instructions is less than one.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If step by step mode is disabled.

stopRunUntilNoOfInstructionsReached

public void stopRunUntilNoOfInstructionsReached()
Stop the fast execution of a number of instructions while being in step by step mode. If setRunUntilNoOfInstructionsReached(long) has not been called earlier, the number of instructions has already been processed or step by step mode is disabled, this method has no effect.

getRunUntilNoOfInstructionsReached

public long getRunUntilNoOfInstructionsReached()
Get the number of instructions left for fast execution. If fast execution is not run, 0 will be returned.

Returns:
The number of instructions left for fast execution.

public Objectref getAnObjectref(ClassFile classFile)
Generate an instance of Objectref for the specified ClassFile. This will invoke the static initializers, if that has not been done, yet.

Parameters:
classFile - The class file to get an object reference for.
Returns:
A new instance of objectref for this ClassFile.
Throws:
java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError - If class initialization fails.
